## Aim


## Data


```{r loads data}
data = read_csv('../data/clean_data.csv')
```

## Methods

Example: The R programming language and the following R packages were used to perform the analysis: knitr and tidyverse. The code used to perform the analysis and create this report can be found here: https://github.com/ttimbers/equine_numbers_value_canada_rmd.

## Results

Inferential Question 1
```{r t-test Subgroups - Numeracy}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(sub_population == 'ABORIGINAL' | sub_population == 'NON ABORIGINAL') %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Numeracy')

t.test(score ~ sub_population, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```

```{r t-test Subgroups - Reading}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(sub_population == 'ABORIGINAL' | sub_population == 'NON ABORIGINAL') %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Reading')

t.test(score ~ sub_population, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```


```{r t-test Subgroups - Writing}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(sub_population == 'ABORIGINAL' | sub_population == 'NON ABORIGINAL') %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Writing')

t.test(score ~ sub_population, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```

Inferential Question 2

```{r t-test School Type - Numeracy}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Numeracy')

t.test(score ~ public_or_independent, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```


```{r t-test School Type - Reading}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Reading')

t.test(score ~ public_or_independent, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```

```{r t-test School Type - Writing}
# Filters data for only the subgroups of interest
filtered_data = data %>%
  filter(fsa_skill_code == 'Writing')

t.test(score ~ public_or_independent, data = filtered_data, var.equal = FALSE)
```

* Streetetal is what you name your reference so you can actually reference it

* to get the citation for a package, type this is the Console: `citation(package = "tidyverse")` where you select the package you want
